page.title: 07"LINTHILL GHAIST"TRANSLATION
page.content: {TRANSLATION OF THE "LINTHILL GHOST"} If you go past old Linthill House you might get a right fright, for they say the ghost of the woman murdered in 1751 still hangs about in a blood stained dress. Mrs Home, the lady that stayed in the big house had gone to bed one night and had just shut her eyes, when a man crept out from under her bed where he had been hiding. He hoped to get the keys of her safe out the pocket of her nightie, but she jumped up and gave such a yell that he panicked and stabbed her over and over again with his clasp knife. The poor woman managed to pull her bell rope before she died. The murderer, her own servant, broke his leg jumping from the window but dragged himself into a field of peas where he was found in the morning. He was the last man to be hanged in chains in Scotland
